resources.string: Necessary to change settings depending on the currently open application.

This app is designed to emulate screen taps using triggers.
It may not work on all firmware or devices except POCO F4 GT.
Please take this into account.

If you think the app should work on your firmware or device, but the app does not work, create an issue on the project's GitHub page.
You changing the settings for the excluded application, but they will not be saved.\nTo change the settings, go to another application.
In the initial setup in each application, the triggers are turned off by default!!!\n\nDon\'t forget to turn them on by double-tapping in a circle.
Root permissions are required for the application to work!\nGrant root permissions to the application and click the \"Try again\" button.

A C++ binary running on a device that:
| Blocks direct transmission of screen click events to the OS, intercepting them for modification.
| Tracks hardware triggers and when they are pressed/released, emulates the corresponding touches using a virtual uinput device.
| Starts an internal server, to receive settings from the client.

If the button is red, create an issue in the project repository.
A class for sending settings to the daemon.\n\nIt will work after opening any application other than this one, and only if the daemon and accessibility service are working properly.

Designed to keep track of currently open apps, i.e. to work customizations for each application.

If he button is red, then try the following steps:
- Exit the app.
- Open settings and find the app.
- Tap "Force close".
- Go back to the app.
